com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class GeneiousActionOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.GeneiousActionOptions

  • public class GeneiousActionOptions
extends Object
    Specifies information (such as the name, description,icon, keyboard shortcut and location) of a menu item or button in Geneious. This is provided by a DocumentOperation or SequenceAnnotationGenerator to indicate to Geneious how to construct the menu item or button that the user clicks on to start the DocumentOperation or AnnotationGenerator. DocumentViewers may also provide actions via DocumentViewer.getActionProvider()

      • ALIGN_ASSEMBLE_MENU_ACTION_OPTIONS

        public static final GeneiousActionOptions ALIGN_ASSEMBLE_MENU_ACTION_OPTIONS
        ActionOptions for the Align/Assemble menu. Use createSubmenuActionOptions(GeneiousActionOptions, GeneiousActionOptions) with this as the parent options to add an operation to the Align/Assemble menu.
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeneiousActionOptions

        public GeneiousActionOptions(String name)
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the action to display in menu or toolbar.

      • GeneiousActionOptions

        public GeneiousActionOptions(String name,
                     String description)
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the action to display in menu or toolbar, must not be null
        description - Description of the actions function, used as a tooltip, or null to have no description

      • GeneiousActionOptions

        public GeneiousActionOptions(String name,
                     String description,
                     Icons icons)
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the action to display in menu or toolbar, must not be null
        description - Description of the actions function, used as a tooltip, or null to have no description
        icons - Icons to display in the toolbar and menu, or null for no icons

      • GeneiousActionOptions

        public GeneiousActionOptions(String name,
                     String description,
                     Icons icons,
                     GeneiousActionOptions.Category category)
        Constructor of GeneiousActionOptions for DocumentOperations that belong to a category (eg. Alignment or TreeBuilding).
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the action to display in menu or toolbar, must not be null
        description - Description of the actions function, used as a tooltip, or null to have no description
        icons - Icons to display in the toolbar and menu, or null for no icons
        category - Category that this operation fits in to, or GeneiousActionOptions.Category.None if it doesn't fit a category, must not be null. This is only used if specifying the action options for a DocumentOperation.

      • GeneiousActionOptions

        @Deprecated
public GeneiousActionOptions(String name,
                                String description,
                                Icons icons,
                                GeneiousActionOptions.Category category,
                                GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu menu,
                                boolean isInPopupMenu,
                                boolean isInMainToolbar,
                                KeyStroke shortcut,
                                boolean isProOnly)
        Deprecated. Use other constructors in combination with setters instead
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the action to display in menu or toolbar, must not be null
        description - Description of the actions function, used as a tooltip, or null to have no description
        icons - Icons to display in the toolbar and menu, or null for no icons
        category - Category that this action fits into, or GeneiousActionOptions.Category.None if it doesn't fit a category, must not be null.
        menu - Main menu to place the action in, GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu.NotPresent to have the action in no menu (must not be null). Ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        isInPopupMenu - True to have the action placed in the popup menu. If this is a Service action, it will be placed in the service popup menu, if this is a DocumentOperation action, it will be placed in the document table popup menu. Ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        isInMainToolbar - True to have the action placed in the toolbar at the top of the main window. Ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        shortcut - Keyboard shortcut for this action
        isProOnly - whether this action requires an active license. If it is, then the action will be disabled automatically if the user doesn't have an active license.

      • createCopy

        protected GeneiousActionOptions createCopy()

      • setMainMenuLocation

        public GeneiousActionOptions setMainMenuLocation(GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu menu)
        Set the location of these action options in the main menu (with the default position of 0.5 - see setMainMenuLocation(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu, double)).
        Parameters:
        menu - Main menu to place the action in, GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu.NotPresent to have the action in no menu (must not be null). Ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setMainMenuLocation(...);)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called after a get method has been called (set methods must be called immediately after constructing the options)

      • setMainMenuLocation

        public GeneiousActionOptions setMainMenuLocation(GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu menu,
                                        double mainMenuPosition)
        Set the location of these action options in the main menu.
        Parameters:
        menu - Main menu to place the action in, GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu.NotPresent to have the action in no menu (must not be null). Ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        mainMenuPosition - A relative position of the action in its menu. Should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is top-most and 1 is the bottom-most. 0.5 is the default. If multiple actions have the same position, they are ordered alphabetically.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setMainmenuLocation(...);)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called after a get method has been called (set methods must be called immediately after constructing the options)

      • setInMainToolbar

        public GeneiousActionOptions setInMainToolbar(boolean isInMainToolbar)
        Set the location of these action options in the main toolbar (with the default position of 0.5 - see setInMainToolbar(boolean, double)).
        Parameters:
        isInMainToolbar - True to have the action made visible in the toolbar at the top of the main window by default (if you pass in false, the operation can still be made visible in the toolbar by the user). Ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setInMainToolbar(...);)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called after a get method has been called (set methods must be called immediately after constructing the options)

      • setInMainToolbar

        public GeneiousActionOptions setInMainToolbar(boolean isInMainToolbar,
                                     double mainToolbarPosition)
        Set the location of these action options in the main toolbar.
        Parameters:
        isInMainToolbar - True to have the action mde visible in the toolbar at the top of the main window (if you pass in false, the operation can still be made visible in the toolbar by the user). Ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        mainToolbarPosition - A relative position of the action in its toolbar. Should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is left-most and 1 is the right-most. 0.5 is the default. If multiple actions have the same position, they are ordered alphabetically.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setInMainToolbar(...);)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called after a get method has been called (set methods must be called immediately after constructing the options)

      • setToolbarPosition

        public GeneiousActionOptions setToolbarPosition(double toolbarPosition)
        Sets the relative position of these action options when they appear in a toolbar. Note that this method on its own won't cause the action options to appear in a toolbar. Consider using setInMainToolbar(boolean, double) instead to make them appear in the main toolbar.
        Parameters:
        toolbarPosition - A relative position of the action in its toolbar. Should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is left-most and 1 is the right-most. 0.5 is the default. If multiple actions have the same position, they are ordered alphabetically.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience)
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • setInPopupMenu

        public GeneiousActionOptions setInPopupMenu(boolean isInPopupMenu)
        Set the location of these action options in the popup menu (with the default position of 0.5 - see setInPopupMenu(boolean, double)).
        Parameters:
        isInPopupMenu - True to have the action placed in the popup menu. If this is a Service action, it will be placed in the service popup menu, if this is a DocumentOperation action, it will be placed in the document table popup menu. Ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setInPopupMenu(...);)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called after a get method has been called (set methods must be called immediately after constructing the options)

      • setInPopupMenu

        public GeneiousActionOptions setInPopupMenu(boolean isInPopupMenu,
                                   double popupMenuPosition)
        Set the location of these action options in the popup menu. If this is a Service action, it will be placed in the service popup menu, if this is a DocumentOperation action, it will be placed in the document table popup menu. This is currently ignored for actions returned from an ActionProvider.
        Parameters:
        isInPopupMenu - True to have the action placed in the popup menu.
        popupMenuPosition - A relative position of the action in its menu. Should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is top-most and 1 is the bottom-most. 0.5 is the default. If multiple actions have the same position, they are ordered alphabetically.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setInPopupMenu(...);)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called after a get method has been called (set methods must be called immediately after constructing the options)

      • addSubmenuDivider

        public GeneiousActionOptions addSubmenuDivider(double position)
        Call this on parentOptions passed into createSubmenuActionOptions(GeneiousActionOptions, GeneiousActionOptions) to add a divider to the resulting sub menu. Can be called multiple times to add several dividers.

        IMPORTANT: This will be ignored for any options other than parentOptions passed to createSubmenuActionOptions(GeneiousActionOptions, GeneiousActionOptions).

        Parameters:
        position - position of the divider relative to other actions in the submenu. Compared to getPopupMenuPosition() for the other actions to determine position.
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).addSubmenuDivider(...);)

      • getSubmenuDividerPositions

        public List<Double> getSubmenuDividerPositions()
        List of positions for dividers if these are parentOptions passed to createSubmenuActionOptions(GeneiousActionOptions, GeneiousActionOptions)
        Returns:
        List of positions for dividers if these are parentOptions passed to createSubmenuActionOptions(GeneiousActionOptions, GeneiousActionOptions)

      • setProOnly

        public GeneiousActionOptions setProOnly(boolean isProOnly)
        Set whether this action requires an active license. If it is, then the action will be disabled automatically if the user doesn't have an active license.
        Parameters:
        isProOnly - whether this action requires an active license
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setProOnly(...);)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called after a get method has been called (set methods must be called immediately after constructing the options)

      • createSubmenuActionOptions

        public static GeneiousActionOptions createSubmenuActionOptions(GeneiousActionOptions parentOptions,
                                               GeneiousActionOptions childOptions)
        Create options for an action which will appear in a submenu (if in a menu) or a popup button (if in the toolbar). setInMainToolbar(boolean) and setMainMenuLocation(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu) must not be called on the child options. These options will be obtained from the parent. However, the order of the actions in the submenu will be determined by their popup menu position value (use setInPopupMenu(boolean, double) to set this.

        eg. The BLAST actions in Geneious are created like this: 

        
 GeneiousActionOptions parent = new GeneiousActionOptions("BLAST this sequence", null, MenuLocation.Tools, true);
 GeneiousActionOptions blastnOptions = new GeneiousActionOptions("blastn", "Searches NCBI blastn for this sequence", null);
 GeneiousActionOptions blastpOptions = new GeneiousActionOptions("blastn", "Searches NCBI blastn for this sequence", null);
 ...
 GeneiousActionOptions blastn = createSubmenuActionOptions(parent, blastnOptions);
 GeneiousActionOptions blastp = createSubmenuActionOptions(parent, blastpOptions);
 ...

        If this is being used to add a popup button to the toolbar you should consider using setToolbarName(String) to set a shorter name and setIcons(Icons) to give the button an icon with a popup triangle.

        To add a divider to the submenu, call addSubmenuDivider(double) on the parent options.

        Parameters:
        parentOptions -
        childOptions -
        Returns:
        new action options with parentOptions as its parent.

      • getMainMenuLocation

        public final GeneiousActionOptions.MainMenu getMainMenuLocation()
        Returns:
        which menu (if any) this action should appear in.

      • getName

        public final String getName()
        Human readable name for action

      • isInPopupMenu

        public final boolean isInPopupMenu()
        Returns:
        true if service action should appear in the popup menu when the service tree is right-clicked (Ctrl+Click on MacOS). If document action or operation should be in the document table popup menu.

      • isInMainToolbar

        public final boolean isInMainToolbar()
        Returns:
        True if the action should appear in the toolbar at the top of the Geneious frame.

      • getDescription

        public final String getDescription()
        Returns:
        A description of the actions function.

      • getShortcut

        public final KeyStroke getShortcut()
        A keyboard shortcut for the action. If these options have an overriden shortcut then this method returns the override keystroke.

        eg. 

        KeyStroke.getKeyStroke(KeyEvent.VK_P, Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getMenuShortcutKeyMask() | InputEvent.SHIFT_MASK)
        do not use KeyEvent.CTRL_MASK! use Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getMenuShortcutKeyMask().
        Returns:
        A keyboard shortcut for the action.

      • getCategory

        public final GeneiousActionOptions.Category getCategory()
        Returns:
        The category that this action fits into

      • isProOnly

        public final boolean isProOnly()
        If true, this action will be always disabled when the user doesn't have an active license. When disabled for this reason it will also have "(restricted)" appended to its name.
        Returns:
        whether this action requires an active license

      • getIdentifier

        public final String getIdentifier()
        This is used so Geneious can identify actions when their name is changed It is simply a concatenation of name and description. It is assigned on construction and never changed;
        Returns:
        an identifier for these action options

      • getParentOptions

        public final GeneiousActionOptions getParentOptions()
        The options of the parent action which represents the submenu this action should appear in.
        Returns:
        parent options or null if no parent (default)

      • getToolbarName

        public String getToolbarName()
        Returns:
        a name possibly different to getName() which should be shorter for display in the main toolbar.

      • getMainMenuPosition

        public double getMainMenuPosition()
        The position of the action in the main menu.
        Returns:
        A relative position of the action in its menu. Should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is top-most and 1 is the bottom-most. 0.5 is the default. If multiple actions have the same position, they are ordered alphabetically.

      • getPopupMenuPosition

        public double getPopupMenuPosition()
        The position of the action in its popup menu.
        Returns:
        A relative position of the action in its menu. Should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is top-most and 1 is the bottom-most. 0.5 is the default. If multiple actions have the same position, they are ordered alphabetically.

      • getMainToolbarPosition

        public double getMainToolbarPosition()
        The position of the action in the main toolbar.
        Returns:
        A relative position of the action in the toolbar. Should be between 0 and 1, where 0 is left-most and 1 is the right-most. 0.5 is the default. If multiple actions have the same position, they are ordered alphabetically.

      • setToolbarName

        public GeneiousActionOptions setToolbarName(String toolbarName)
        Set name to be used when this action is displayed in the main toolbar. Should be shorter than normal name.
        Parameters:
        toolbarName - The name to be used when this action is displayed in the main toolbar or null to use the normal name.only
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setToolbarName(...);)

      • isAvailableToWorkflows

        public boolean isAvailableToWorkflows()
        Returns:
        true if the operation should be available to be run from workflows. Any DocumentOperation or AnnotationGenerator which has set a menu location will automatically be marked as available to workflows unless setAvailableToWorkflows(false) is called. DocumentOperations and AnnotationGenerators not normally visible to users can be exposed from workflows only using setAvailableToWorkflows(true)
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)
        See Also:
        setAvailableToWorkflows(boolean)

      • setAvailableToWorkflows

        public GeneiousActionOptions setAvailableToWorkflows(boolean availableToWorkflows)
        Sets whether or not a DocumentOperation or AnnotationGenerator is available to workflows. If this method is not called, then the default behaviour is for visible operations to be available to workflows and invisible operations and generators to not be available.
        Parameters:
        availableToWorkflows - true to make it available to workflows
        Returns:
        this (for convenience eg. return new GeneiousActionOptions(...).setAvailableToWorkflows(...);)
        Since:
        API 4.700 (Geneious 7.0.0)
        See Also:
        isAvailableToWorkflows()

      • getDefaultShortcut

        public KeyStroke getDefaultShortcut()
        Returns:
        the default keystroke shortcut for these options, ignoring any overriden shortcut. null for no shortcut.
        See Also:
        getShortcut()

      • setOverrideShortcut

        public void setOverrideShortcut(KeyStroke keyStroke)
        Set a shortcut keystroke to override the default.
        Parameters:
        keyStroke - the new shortcut keystroke to use or null for no shortcut.

      • addShortcutChangeListener

        public static void addShortcutChangeListener(GeneiousActionOptions.ShortcutChangeListener shortcutChangeListener)

        Parameters:
        shortcutChangeListener - the listener to add

        Parameters:
        shortcutChangeListener - the listener to remove
